title: So I did some bar napkin math...
body: ...It's going to take me about a year at the current rate of 1 checkpoint every 3 months to go from 2/3 honor 0 to honor 2. Why does it have to be such a slog?

replies.body:
> ...It's going to take me about a year at the current rate of 1 checkpoint every 3 months to go from 2/3 honor 0 to honor 2. Why does it have to be such a slog?

Well, if it's taking you a long time to gain Honor, then it's probable that you're still misbehaving in games. How frequently do you play, and how do you behave in the matches you do play? Do you talk at all? If so, do you have a tendency to make passive-aggressive comments, spread negativity, or harass players?

You should be striving to put your best foot forward and be honorable. If you're not doing that, then you're not going to be progressing much at all.

I have both allied and enemy chat, as well as all emotes muted, I never type anything, only ping when necessary, etc. I play maybe 2 games per day on a normal day. 3-5 on a day where I have some extra free time.

I was honor 5 in 2018, and top 20% of behavior on 2 accounts as well has having the mentor, honorable opponent, and friendly player ribbons back in the old honor system.

This punishment is the result of me retaliating against harassment. I never call people out for poor play, or flame or anything like that, but until the ability to disable allied chat was implemented, I would most definitely retaliate against negative behavior directed towards myself or another player in game.

>I have both allied and enemy chat, as well as all emotes muted, I never type anything, only ping when necessary, etc. 

hence the problem

by not typing or communicating with your team other than through pings, you're displaying a refusal to communicate, not a refusal to be toxic. And there's a difference

you'll progress, sure. But it will be at a much slower rate than if you actually used the chat in a constructive, non toxic manner.

>This punishment is the result of me retaliating against harassment. I never call people out for poor play, or flame or anything like that, but until the ability to disable allied chat was implemented, I would most definitely retaliate against negative behavior directed towards myself or another player in game.

unfortunately, "retaliating" to flame by flaming back is still flaming. "he started it"or "he was more toxic than what i said"aren't valid justifications to flame.

I suppose I could spend all game every game being like "Yeah good job! Yay woohoo let's go team! T E A M what does that spell? TEAM!"

But I can't afford to replace all the keyboards I'd ruin by vomiting on them.
Honestly, all you have to do is end each game with a 'gg'. You can literally type nothing else and make it to honor 5 if you do that.

i suggest going on youtube and watching "The Glacierr". he's a Garen/Darius one trick that makes videos every other day and sometimes he types instructions to his team when he's splitpushing. Otherwise he ignores the chat. You should take a page from his book .

I'm not a particularly chatty person, having chat enabled does 2 things:
-Distract me from the game.
-Risk tilting me when someone starts flaming.

Neither of those things are beneficial.

Would it be rude to say I waltzed, nay, *sashayed*- or perhaps **casually strolled**- to honor 5 without any thought or regard to the honor system?

I can't see your play history so I can't compare how much you play.

that's what happens when you don't get punished

in my case i've played less games this season than the people struggling in bronze would like to know about and i got honor 3 checkpoint 3 the other day.

if  one isn't toxic, the system is very generous
I don't play much anymore, the game is as fun as it's always been, but the power creep is real, and I don't have enough bans to fully enjoy it.

So normally people gain a checkpoint once every 2 - 3 weeks. You using 3 months per checkpoint means that you are either not playing enough, or you are still toxic within your chat.

If you want to progress faster try these things;

1. Play many games
2. exhibit positive honorable chat. (even if you don't use chat, you'll still progress, just that a positive chat accelerates the progress rate)
3. Earn team honor bonus
4. .
5. .
6. .
7. ???
8. Earn your personal honors

Personal honors means very little in progressing honors.

For reference, popular streamer ImaQTPie went from H1-0 to H2-0 in 3 weeks.
